content.question: Which of the following is a natural minor scale?

choices.label: The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes over two measures in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The key signature has two sharps. There is one additional accidental which is A-sharp.

The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes over two measures in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The key signature has two sharps. There are additional accidentals which are G-sharp and A-sharp.
The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes over two measures in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The key signature has two sharps.

The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes over two measures in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The key signature has two sharps. There are additional accidentals which are D-sharp, G-sharp and A-sharp.

content.answer: The figure presents a series of eight ascending quarter notes over two measures in bass clef, beginning on B2 and ending on B3. The key signature has two sharps.

unit.text: 2: Music Fundamentals II - Minor Scales and Key Signatures, Melody, Timbre, and Texture

topic.text: 2.1: Minor Scales - Natural, Harmonic, and Melodic

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in notated music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
